What Are Protein Donuts?

Protein donuts are a healthier take on the beloved fried treat, baked instead of fried and packed with protein to transform an indulgent dessert into a macro-friendly snack. By using protein powder, Greek yogurt, and other nutritious ingredients, these donuts deliver 15-25 grams of protein per serving while dramatically reducing calories and fat.

Unlike traditional donuts that are deep-fried and loaded with sugar, protein donuts are baked in special donut pans, creating that classic ring shape with a fraction of the guilt. The result is a lighter, fluffier donut that satisfies your cravings without derailing your nutrition goals.

From glazed vanilla to chocolate frosted, apple cider to maple bacon, protein donuts offer all your favorite flavors with improved nutrition. They are perfect for breakfast, post-workout treats, or anytime you want something sweet that actually supports your health goals.

Benefits of Protein Donuts

Baked, Not Fried

All the donut flavor without the excess oil and calories of deep frying.

High Protein Treat

Pack 15-25g of protein into each donut for muscle-supporting nutrition.

Lower Calorie Options

Typically 150-250 calories per donut versus 300-500 for traditional.

Customizable Toppings

Create endless varieties with protein-enhanced glazes and toppings.

Perfect Breakfast Protein

Start your day with dessert-like breakfast that actually fuels you.

Fun to Make

Kids and adults love the donut-making process and decorating.

Types of Protein Donuts

Classic Glazed Protein Donuts

Vanilla cake donuts with a protein-enhanced sweet glaze. The crowd favorite.

Chocolate Protein Donuts

Rich chocolate cake donuts, perfect plain or with chocolate frosting.

Baked Apple Cider Donuts

Fall favorite with apple cider and cinnamon sugar coating.

Protein Donut Holes

Bite-sized donut balls perfect for portion control and snacking.

Best Ingredients for Protein Donuts

Protein Sources

  • Vanilla Protein Powder
  • Chocolate Protein Powder
  • Greek Yogurt
  • Cottage Cheese
  • Egg Whites

flours

  • Oat Flour
  • Whole Wheat Flour
  • Almond Flour
  • Coconut Flour
  • All-Purpose Flour

glazes

  • Protein Powder Glaze
  • Greek Yogurt Frosting
  • Sugar-Free Chocolate
  • Maple Glaze

How to Make Perfect Protein Donuts

1

Mix Dry Ingredients

Whisk protein powder, flour, baking powder, and spices in a large bowl.

2

Combine Wet Ingredients

Mix eggs, Greek yogurt, milk, sweetener, and vanilla in a separate bowl.

3

Create Batter

Fold wet into dry until just combined. Batter should be thick but pourable.

4

Fill & Bake

Pipe or spoon batter into greased donut pan, filling 2/3 full. Bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes.

5

Glaze & Enjoy

Let cool 5 minutes, then dip in protein glaze or frosting. Allow glaze to set before serving.

Frequently Asked Questions

How much protein is in a protein donut?
Our protein donut recipes typically contain 15-25 grams of protein per donut, depending on the recipe and size.
Do protein donuts taste like real donuts?
Yes! Baked protein donuts have a wonderful cake-like texture. While not identical to fried, they are delicious in their own right.
Do I need a special donut pan?
A silicone or non-stick donut pan is recommended for the classic ring shape. You can also make donut holes using a mini muffin pan.
Why are my protein donuts dry?
Too much protein powder or over-baking. Reduce protein or add more Greek yogurt/applesauce for moisture.
How do I make a protein glaze?
Mix protein powder with a little milk until smooth and pourable. Add sweetener to taste.
Can protein donuts be made ahead?
Yes! Store unglazed donuts in airtight container for up to 4 days or freeze for 2 months. Add glaze before serving.
Are protein donuts good for weight loss?
They can fit into a weight loss plan as a controlled indulgence. Much better choice than traditional donuts.
Can protein donuts be vegan?
Absolutely! Use plant protein, flax eggs, dairy-free yogurt, and non-dairy milk for vegan protein donuts.
